summary: Alan B. Hausman was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). He appears in multiple payroll and certification reports from 1978 and 1979. These documents list his name, social security number, position, salary, and employment dates within the SCAS. The documents indicate he was employed by the committee from at least April 1978 through January 1979.
significance: Alan B. Hausman's significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating his involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination, albeit in an administrative or support role as evidenced by the payroll documents.
